comment: This is one of the best professors at KSU! He is kind, genuinely cares about his students, and always gives great feedback. He makes it easy to earn an A in this class. The weekly work is easy. You can do extra credit instead of a paper. There was only one test, and it was short and simple. Take his class, you won't regret it.
Professor Miller is an amazing teacher who really cares about his students. The workload is manageable, and he's understanding. unstuck ai was a great help for study prep.

He deserves his high rating. I don't usually have strong opinions on profs i take online, but he is genuinely such a kind guy. Super approachable and understanding. He encourages participations and mentions when you're doing well. I can't recommend him enough
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He is amazing! As a professor, he is willing to extend deadlines and loves to conversate with the class. He is well loved and respected by most. I would take him again if I ever see him in future classes (:

Prof. Miller is so understanding of his students, do not take advantage of this man! There is a lot of reading, which was expected. Textbook is required, I found it online for free. Easy to make 100's on weekly work, 1-2 paragraph of insights or questions of the topic. Research paper isn't required, you can still make an A by doing an extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Love this class and the professor! Each week you had to turn in notes on what you read. He gave great feedback very quick. He also made teaching fun. He did have some opportunities for extra credit. Over all he was very kind and cared about his students. 10/10 would take another of his classes.

Professor Miller is the best professor I have had at KSU. He really wants his students to learn and answers all emails and allows for extra credit. If you show effort you will get a good grade in his class. He will help you with anything you will ever need.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He was such a great professor, took the time to give each student individual feedback on assignments, which I thought was super nice of him. Take his class!

This was the best class I have ever taken in college. Professor Miller was very thoughtful and gave excellent feedback on every assignment I completed. He also offered extra credit instead of doing the final research paper. If you're looking for an easy A, this is the class you need to take.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I loved this professor, he was caring, and gave me extensions on both assignments I asked for one on

I can't say enough good things about this professor. This class was pretty easy too and don't have to buy a textbook. Each week you read some material and then you write a discussion post on it and how you felt about it. Two tests no lockdown and open note and he lets you decide if you want to do a research paper or the extra credit options or both
Loved this prof!! :) he was very kind, understanding, and offered extra credit. The workload was kind of heavy at times, but he was understanding and a great teacher. I would 100% take him again.
Great teaching, plenty of opportunities for extra credit, deadlines are not strict, highly recommend.

Dr. Miller was a fantastic teacher! Even though I took him online, I feel like I really know him. His assignments are consistent each week and pretty easy. I feel like I learned a lot through this class and I appreciate his curiosity to always learn more. The only thing I'll mention is that sometimes it just feels like he's trying to sell his books

This is a great class to take if you need an elective, want to obtain a A, and learn more about religion. There are weekly writing assignments due each week ( 2 paragraphs), two exams, and some discussion posts. Honestly, just do the work and you should get an A.

I loved Dr. Miller! He makes the class interesting and really fun. He gives plenty of extra credit opportunities as well. Super fair grader and you can tell he really cares about his work and his students. I definitely recommend him! Also, all work is open note!

Professor Miller is hands down one of the easiest professors I have ever had. There is a book that we read chapters from. I usually just looked up the summary for each chapter. He often gives feedback about assignments through email. Grades consist of 2 tests, some weekly wisdoms, a research paper, and discussion. He does offer extra credit.

This class was amazing! So much so that i am taking his class again next semester. Basically all that we did was Weekly Wisdom assignments (super easy) and one test! He gave automatic 100s on the final! Great professor!!
Responsive instructor who cares about his students!

My favorite professor I've ever taken. He is extremely kind and cares about all of his students. He gives a lot of homework but as long as you complete it you'll do well. He gives extra credit opportunity and is understanding and lets you turn in hw late if you need to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: In simple words, take this class with Prof Miller. He truly cares about you and your well being versus his assignments getting turn in on time or whatnot. There is extra credit and he allows you to redo assignments. He always responds to emails. There is a lot of reading, but it is a college class - so compared to others, the workload is enough.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best teacher at KSU!!! No lockdown browser or webcam
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Miller is fantastic and actually CARES about students! Just participate and try the Professor will grade you for effort. I took his Religion class and found myself respecting his many books and opinions on certain religious aspects. Thanks!
sweetest man ever. gives tons of feedback and explanation of assignments. easy A

Professor Miller has been an amazing teacher. I took his class online this semester, and he really does care about his students. I even once watched the incorrect debate for an assignment but completed the same tasks for this debate, and he still gave me full credit. Not super hard if you do the work, and he is extremely kind and passionate.

I can't say enough about Dr. Miller, he is an absolute joy of a professor to take. The nature of the class removes a lot of objectivity but as long as your writing is coherent and your arguments are sound he will give you a good grade. He is lookin for you to be able to read theology and draw your own conclusions from it, not justify or support his
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Miller is an amazing professor and a very caring individual. The work is straightforward and easy to follow as long as you do the reading. I took this class online so I didn't have him in person but he is great at engaging every student by responding to each student individually which creates an easy opportunity to communicate with him.

The best Professor I've ever had. He genuinely cares about you and wants you to succeed. He goes out of his way to make sure you do well and his class was very interesting. Probably the only class in college I have really enjoyed and feel like I gained something long term from. I can't recommend him enough. He's also really funny and interesting.
This class helped me throughout my first semester, and the professor made this course easy!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: He provides a lot of reading but you benefit greatly from it. He really does care about you and wants you to succeed. Much of his material are books that he has written, one of which is extremely useful for your entire academic life and beyond. I highly recommend having him as your professor!
Literally a GOAT!!
Prof Miller is one of the best professors I've ever had. I ended the course with a 105 grade.
Hes the best professor that I had so far!!!
Recommended!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly, I loved Mr. Miller. If I could take him again, I would. Hes honestly GREAT! He gets straight to the point, he will not lead you in the wrong direction!
The best professor at Kennesaw State University! Im glad as a freshman I went here because of Dr. Miller!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The class was really interesting and he was really dedicated to all of his students success. He assigns a lot of reading, but makes sure you know that if you get overwhelmed you dont have to read it all. He is a really motivating and caring professor and just wants you to do well without any stress. 10/10 would recommend.
Professor Miller is the best professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: TAKE DR. MILLER. Easy A!
Professor Miller is the best professor I've ever had!

Professor Miller is the best professor I've ever had! Rels 1102 is consisted of writing two paragraphs each week on a certain topic. There are a few discussions and a research paper that is very easy. He also offers extra credit. Take this class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Steve Miller was by far the best professor I've ever had. All he wants you to do is succeed and he makes sure there is plenty of opportunities for that to happen.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment: Easiest Professor at Kennesaw State University! I got any A in this course!

Prof Miller is one of the best professors I've ever had. I ended the course with a 105 grade. He truly cares about what his students have to say and what they learn. The course is very easy to manage and he is very easy to get in touch with. I learned a lot from him!

Steve Miller was by far the best professor I've ever had. All he wants you to do is succeed and he makes sure there is plenty of opportunities for that to happen. This class was online so you have to be responsible but he reaches out constantly to check on you. I would take him again if I could.

We were graded on daily assignemtns, a midterm, a final, and a research paper. Dr. Miller was a very reasonable grader, and he let students turn assignments in late for full credit. I would highly recommend taking him in any course given the opportunity.

TAKE DR. MILLER. He genuinely cares about students, gives you numerous opportunities to be successful, and promotes a fun learning environment. He provides you with the textbook for free, and assigns fun, interesting readings. He's a great guy and I'd take him again and again

He is the absolute best! Take him if you can! He cares way more about you actually learning than about you getting a grade. The class was set up so the majority of your grade is candid weekly reflections based on the reading. There's 2 tests, a paper, and some weekly discussions. He also offers extra credit.

Easy class with a great professor! Have weekly widsom assignments and an optional paper with extra credit obtions! I never felt like I was wasting my time with "busy work." This course was also extremely flexible as it allowed me to work around my other classes and work schedule. 100% recommend taking this course!

Dr. Miller is the best!! Super sweet and caring and knows what he's talking about!! Online classes are easy to slack in but Dr. Miller makes it so you don't want to. He is engaging and the readings are super interesting. I genuinely learned so much in this class. 10/10 would recommend!!

Professor Miller is by far one of the BEST teachers I've had at KSU. He truly cares about what he's teaching and his students. This class dabbles into different religions, and he wants to make sure you understand you're reading. Your opinion is just that, yours, and you won't be made to think that you're wrong. This class truly makes you think.
Good Teacher. As long as you turn in the work you'll pass with a good grade. Plenty of extra credit.

Take this professor. He is the most caring teacher I have ever come across. He emails feedback about every assignment and also emails back very fast if you have questions. There is one assignment due every Saturday and a discussion post every once in awhile that are based off previous assignments. Two tests and he provides study guides. The best!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best Professor ever. Super nice. Responded to every assignment with full emails of really helpful feedback, when I was interested in something he sent me a bunch of resources on it related specifically to my major. Super cool and nice guy. First Gen ed class I actually enjoyed. Also very easy A but I learned stuff.

When I say Intro to Religious Studies, do you automatically think: Intro to Christianity is the Only Truth? If no, then avoid like the plague! Prof is very kind, caring, and flexible, but the first 8 weeks are spent talking about how science can't explain what Christians can. If you like to be treated like a child in Sunday School, take him.

Really really good, caring professor. It was an online course so there was a lot of discussions and writing assignments, but only one paper that's kinda optional and a couple of easy tests/quizzes. He's a really fast responder to his emails and lenient on grading. Overall a good professor and an easy class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: An amazing professor who cares about his students. He always responds to your emails and is very lenient with late work. The class is an easy A, but there is a good amount of reading every week and there are discussion posts. I would highly recommend taking this class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Love Professor Miller! I enjoyed going to his class and learned so much!

I loved this professor. He really cares about his students. He emails a lot and answers all your questions. If you put the work in, you will be rewarded. He gives you a lot of freedom with your assignments as well.

He is super nice and caring. He does care about his students. His class was very simple and he told us exactly what he expected. I did learn a lot even though I was not expecting to. He does require students to buy the online access code for daily assignments. The midterm and final were not bad at all. Just show up and do your work.

First of all, if you think that this class is difficult, then you are not going to pass any of your other classes at KSU. While I found this class to be very easy, it was also super informational and I learned a lot. I chose this as a free elective and I would choose it again without a doubt. Professor Miller is a great guy who is very knowledgable

I absolutely LOVE this professor. He post videos every week and i watch them weekly just for the fun of it. He is so genuine and cares about every single student more than the grade itself. I wish everyone would take his courses!!!

Professor Miller is one of the most genuine and down to earth professors Ive had so far. He genuinely cares so much about his students and wants to see everyone succeed. Its a very easy class if you put forth the effort and take it seriously. He lectures almost the whole duration of class, but if you listen he has genuine advice. Absolutely take!

He is one of the best professors at KSU. He is helpful and cares about his students. There are discussion posts and weekly wisdom each week but it is really easy. He gives study guides for the test which is helpful too. Highly recommend taking him!

Highly recommend him. He does talk a lot but is a good person ! He cares and will work with you. Daily writing assignments, easy projects, easy mid term and final. Show up, he gives you answers to midterm and final in class!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: I thought religion would be an easy class after an easy KSU seminoar class, but this class is so much work. Group projects and presentations. Hard tests. I regret taking this class. More work than any of my other upper level classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Best professor I have had at KSU! Genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed, not just in this class but throughout college. Short responses to reading due every Tuesday and Thursday. 2 tests the entire semester, midterm and final. Gives you plenty of chances to make an A in the class.
This man is the GOAT of Kennesaw

Steve was great at getting us engaged in discussions in class an applying what we have learned about critical thinking! All of his subjects were very exciting and interesting. He also has a great sense of humor. He is a very warm, approachable, flexible, understanding, professor and it is clear he is very invested in our success. BEST PROF. EVER!

Steve Miller is one of the best professors Ive ever had. He allows opportunity to add 10 extra credit points to your final grade and makes a genuine effort to personally know each one of his students through specific feedback and encouragement. He is understanding and gives studyguides that outline the entire exam to make sure youre prepared.
GREAT professor. He's humble, kind, and loves what he is doing. TAKE HIM! & he understands that this is an elective. This class taught me a lot and made me think about things! GREAT class!
This has to be the best Proffesor or teacher Ive ever had in my life. He loved me so much that he put me on the phone with one of his kids once. Anyways, hes probably the nicest guy youll ever meet.
He is an amazing professor he wants you to make an A! He wants kids to enjoy the class and want to go everyday.

Probably will be the best professor i have ever taken, cares more about what you get out of the class then the actual grading or test performance like every other class. He wants you to succeed and do your very best. I would not recommend anyone more.
great prof... easy A and he is very genuine
10/10 Recommend. Hes the sweetest guy ever & really cares about the success of his students.
Absolutely great guy. Really wants you to succeed, extremely easy A. The midterm and final only count for a small percentage of the grade.

Steve is an inspirational professor. He genuinely cares about his students, and he wants to see everybody be successful in college and beyond. If you are struggling or fighting against the idea of going to college, take this class. He will open your eyes to all the possibilities waiting for you.

He's amazing; he honestly cares about his students. He wants to help in any way he can, and asks how your week has been. If you're having trouble with anything, he'll try to help you. He has homework due before every meeting, but they're easy. Only buy the foundation book, and he provides the rest. Mid-term and final are easy as long as you listen.

Steve was a great professor. you can tell he really cares about his students as people, not just students, and is genuinely interested in their lives outside of class. he does give regular homework, but it is very easy and does not take long at all. would definitely take his class again

He is the best teacher I have ever had. His lectures are whatever is on his mind that day. Notes are not necessary. The study guide for midterm and final is exactly what is on the test. He's so great. highly Recommended.

This is one of the most supportive and caring professors ive had so far. The homework is super easy and the class is really helpful. Only 2 tests for the whole semester. I highly recommended choosing him.

One of the best teachers for KSU seminar. He assigns homework daily, but it's nothing you can not handle because it only requires you to read a couple pages a day, and then write insights on the text. Class is really enjoyable because he tries to get students to discuss problems you may have in college or in life. Then he will help you solve them.
Great guy. He really cares about his students and creates an individual relationship with each one. You have daily wisdom due before each class which is basically just 3 bullet points.

Steve is the BEST. He truly cares about his students. The class only consists of daily wisdoms due each day of class (they're super easy and literally take like 5 minutes to do), a midterm, one essay, two paragraphs on events you went to, a presentation, and a final. He's amazing and the class is so easy. Take him if you can!

Steve was such a nice professor. There is homework every class but if you do it and show up to class, it is an easy A. He doesn't make the class difficult but is knowledgeable and wise. I learned a lot in his class and plan to take him again. He is also very caring and understanding and is always willing to work with you.

He is the best professor I have ever had. He truly cares about his students passing and as long as you go to class and do your Daily Wisdom you will pass. He only gives a Mid term and Final and a Few papers and his study guides are the best. If you study you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Very good prof. He is very well read, good at sharing knowledge and good at connecting to class. He is very understanding, one of the most caring professors I would say. He is passionate about Religious Studies, but he is very humble and wants your feedback and corrections. I loved learning from him. Like they've all said before MUST TAKE HIM!

Take him!!! He is the best professor ever. There is homework and a paper and 2 tests. All of it is so easy because he wants you to do well! He really cares about his students and wants to get to know you. Best decision to take his class, wish he taught other classes.
LITERALLY THE BEST PROF OF ALL TIME! A MUST TAKE

Seriously one of the best professors I have ever had!! He is so lenient and understanding. He gives very clear study guides for his tests to where it's literally impossible to NOT get an A. My only complaint would be that all he really talked about was Christianity and philosophy when I thought I was going to be learning about different religions.

Dr. Miller is the bomb! He is super nice and knows a lot about religious studies and makes it interesting. There is homework due before every class but at most takes an hour. There is only a paper, midterm and final so it is very easy to pass.

You have to take one of these classes, make sure you take Mr. Millers. He makes you buy one 20 dollar text book, and the rest he gives to you cause he wrote the other text books. He really just wants you to think about your future. I struggled with work and school, and at the end of the semester he gave me 2 full letter grades worth of xtra credit.

Mr. Steve was awesome, everyone in the class loved him. He was more like a friend than a teacher. There was a lot of work and a lot of reading, with a homework assignment due every night before class. Midterm and final were easy, and there was one paper. If you do the work, easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Literally the best teacher I have ever had! Attendance not mandatory, but you genuinely don't want to miss! Brings class coffee and very interactive lectures! Busy work for HW every week, but easy! Will give extra credit if needed, always emails back! Impossible to leave the class without new friends! 100% would take again if I could!
The nicest guy I've probably ever met.  Super easy class just do your work and communicate with him if you have problems he will be completely understanding.  You'll enjoy going to class everyday!

Steve is one of the sweetest professors i've ever met. He's willing to help students in any way he can, and gives grant feedback on work, as well as advice on anything you may need. Overall, Steve is amazing in every way possible.

Steve is my favorite professor I've had so far. Anyone will love him. He's VERY understanding, time flexible, and he genuinely cares about all of his students. He knows he's really bad with names. He's funny, and he loves classic rock n roll. He does his best to entertain, and has a lot of fun group discussions. Not just boring lectures.
TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He is the coolest guy. Always so understanding and approachable. He has been my favorite professor by far. An easy A if you do the work.

"Steve" has by far been one of my favorite all time teachers. He genuinely cares about anyone that walks through his door and he wants you to succeed and do well in college and beyond. He is a philosopher and storyteller first and a teacher second so prepare to hear a lot of relevant stories. Workloadlight but beneficial. Everything has a reason.
Awesome teacher, super humble and well read. He teaches without partiality
Professor Miller is the G.O.A.T.

He was a really great professor! We had to read a goof bit but what we read was super interesting. Most of our classes were just discussion based. He was very efficient at always answering emails and giving feedback when needed. Neither the midterm or final were too hard. I learned a lot from him; would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: GREAT teacher! By far the most caring! I'd 100% recommend. Homework after every class but an easy A. Loved him. He'd bring coffee sometimes to class and understands we have other classes and busy schedules. Most of the books we read are ones he wrote but are free PDF. Only mandatory to purchase one book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: He is a gem of KSU! Asks you to call him "Steve," and is more of a caring life coach than a professor. Genuinely cares about the well-being of students, and will check-up on you regularly. Realized I don't HAVE to go to class, but I go every week because of what I get out of it. Everyone has to take a seminar SO TAKE HIS.
Really great guy. I really didn't want to take a seminar, but I ended up finding a few friends there.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Miller is the best! You won't regret taking his class. So easy going and fun and easy to get along with. Offers so much help theres no way to not get an A in his class. Would take again a million times over. Love this guy!

Mr. Miller is one of the best professors I have ever had. He really adapts to what works best for students. The first day we got to choose what we wanted to learn about in this course. He does his best to make the material interesting and offers a ton of extra credit! Attendance isn't mandatory, but honestly I liked going. Easy class!

Great Guy. Professor Miller is there for every single one of his students. He understands that his class is a requirement and he does his best to make it easy on you. Very easy class, questions on tests are given to you in review sessions. He really likes to hear others opinions and thoughts. As long as he sees that you care, he will pass you.

Steve is an amazing professor. He really loves his job and cares about his students. The class is very easy but he tries to make it enjoyable. I highly recommend this class. As long as you show up and do your daily wisdom its an easy A. the final and midterm are extremely easy but go to the review because he  practically gives you the answers.
Steve was awesome. By far the best teacher I've ever had. Super nice guy, definitely cares about you as a student. 10/10 would recommend

Professor Miller is awesome.  He is extremely friendly, laid back and is willing to go out of his way to help his students succeed. He's one of the best, if not THE best professor I've ever had up to this point, and it's not even close. Professor Miller is truly special, so if you do have a chance to take him, DO IT!

Miller is one of the best teachers I've ever had. One of the most caring, sweet, and genuine guys I've met. He actually cares about his students succeeding. He's so understanding, and he knows we all have at least 4-5 classes so he makes his class as easy as possible--he just wants you to learn something! 100% recommend him. Made an 8am worth it.

The best professor I have had here at Kennesaw State. He is such a nice, understanding guy. Unlike other professors, he wants you to feel like you and him are equals and at the same level. Does not want to give off an intimidating professor vibe. You will have homework after every class, but it is not hard. He really wants his students to succeed.

Extremely helpful and loves what he does. Class can sometimes be boring  but he is very clear on assignments, grading and always tries to give feedback. Great person and really nice. Would take him again if he taught another course
Steve is the best professor I have had so far! I can tell that he honestly cares about his students and is willing to help his students in anyway possible!

Great teacher, I never go to his class and as long as you do the work he assigns based off of the syllabus, you should do well. He assigns projects every now and then but they're simple. He likes to talk about his family and how he's a writer and his book is alright, but not very interesting what so ever. Great guy though.
HE IS AWESOME. He will literally help you with anything, considering you respect him the way he respects you. Simply put, he is an easy A but a meaningful A. Take him!
Take Him! I am in his freshman seminar class right now. H e is a great teacher and a great guy. He teaches material that is actually useful in life.

Steve was an awesome teacher to have for my freshman seminar class!! He's funny and he'll do anything to make sure you get an A. He does want you to read a lot (even though you don't have to) and he has daily assignments (which are easy). Final and Midterm are easier than breathing and he makes class fun.

Professor Miller is by far one of my favorite teachers. Great person. He is funny, nice, smart, and really cares about his students. He really makes sure that we learn more than just textbook knowledge and is really awesome on help and extra credit. Be honest with him and he'll give you whatever help you need. EASY tests. ABSOLUTELY TAKE HIM.

Professor Miller is one of my favorite professors. He is down to earth, and will work with you in every possible way to make sure you pass and do well in the course. The work load is extremely small and very practical. If you have to take this class, I would recommend Professor Miller every single time.
If you are taking this class, get this teacher. Hands down the best person I have met at KSU and is very passionate about teaching and about people.

Just a great down to earth guy to have as a professor in a class that prepares you for the road ahead in college. His classes are not mandatory, but his lectures are fun, informative, and interesting! He strives for student success and shows it. No tests, mandatory reading and gives mid and final questions beforehand, which are the same as the exam

Mr. Miller is engaging and funny, held discussions in each class which he used to compile questions for his "tests", which weren't hard at all. The answers were provided on a study guide beforehand. Show up to class, and complete your portion of a small group project and you'll get an A. He doesn't want to fail anyone, but you still have to work.

Excellent guy.  There is homework before every class, but it is generally very brief.  Quizzes and tests are easy if you pay attention.  Professor Miller is very helpful and actually cares about his students.  If you put in the work, you'll do fine.  Overall a very good first year class, I would highly recommend.
Great teacher! great guy. He is very nice and he is very helpful. His class is very easy and he is a very light grader. I suggest taking him because he will help you out your first year.
